meanings.definition: An acute infectious disease caused by a bacterium that affects the nervous system, leading to muscle stiffness and spasms.
meanings.sent1: After stepping on a rusty nail, he had to get a shot to prevent tetanus.
meanings.sent2: The doctor administered a tetanus vaccine to protect against the disease.
meanings.sent3: When the rusty robot started dancing, everyone joked it must have caught tetanus.
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure gripped her mind like tetanus, paralyzing her from taking any risks.
meanings.sent5: The image of the rusty nail piercing his skin haunted him like a case of tetanus.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by sustained muscle contractions, typically caused by the bacterium Clostridium tetani.
meanings.sent1: The athlete experienced tetanus in his leg muscles after running the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The physical therapist helped relieve the tetanus in her patient's muscles.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot malfunctioned, causing it to have a case of tetanus in its movements.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, it felt like a cloud of tetanus hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the situation caused a tightness in her chest, like a sudden onset of tetanus.
